This article will provide a comprehensive comparison between Compass vs Keller Williams to help you determine which brokerage better aligns with your professional goals. Choosing the right brokerage is a critical decision for any real estate agent, as it significantly impacts their career trajectory and financial success.

Commission Splits and Fees
Income Opportunities
Training and Support
Technology and Resources
Agent Satisfaction
Final Thoughts on Compass vs Keller Williams
Join our FREE Team at eXp Realty

Commission Splits and Fees

The commission splits and associated fees are crucial factors to consider when selecting a brokerage. Keller Williams offers flexible splits ranging from 70/30 to 100/0, with a 6% franchise/royalty fee until the cap is reached. Compass provides splits starting at 60/40 and going up to 92.5/7.5, with no franchise/royalty fee, and only some agents get a production cap.

Monthly fees for Keller Williams vary by office, whereas Compass charges $145 and varies by office. Additionally, Keller Williams does not charge transaction fees, while Compass charges up to 4% per transaction. Keller Williams has a more straightforward fee structure, potentially making it more predictable for agents.

Income Opportunities

The potential for additional income streams can significantly enhance an agent’s financial stability and growth. Keller Williams stands out by offering revenue share programs that provide a retirement and willable income path. These additional income streams can offer substantial long-term financial benefits and security. Conversely, Compass does not offer such supplementary income opportunities, limiting agents primarily to their commission-based earnings.

Training and Support

Effective training and support are vital for both new and experienced agents. Keller Williams excels in this area, providing extensive training opportunities, though specific details on the extent of their offerings are not standardized across all offices. Agents at Keller Williams also benefit from various support structures, although 24/7 support is not available. In contrast, Compass offers training through Compass Academy, but similar to Keller Williams, 24/7 support is not provided. This difference can be crucial for agents who require ongoing assistance and professional development.

Technology and Resources

In the modern real estate landscape, leveraging technology effectively is essential. Keller Williams is known for its robust technology platforms, offering tools that enhance productivity and client engagement. On the other hand, Compass is also recognized for its technological advancements, including its Compass Academy for training. Both brokerages provide valuable technological resources, but the specific tools and platforms offered may appeal differently depending on the agent’s needs.

Agent Satisfaction

Agent satisfaction is a key indicator of a brokerage’s effectiveness and overall agent happiness. Keller Williams boasts a high Glassdoor rating of 4.3 stars based on 7.9K reviews, indicating strong agent approval and satisfaction. Compass holds a lower rating of 3.7 stars from 2.4K reviews, suggesting that there may be areas needing improvement. The differences in agent satisfaction can often be attributed to the varying levels of support, training, and income opportunities provided by each brokerage.

Final Thoughts on Compass vs Keller Williams

In comparing Compass and Keller Williams, it’s evident that Keller Williams offers more favorable commission splits, extensive training, and additional income opportunities, making it a compelling choice for both new and experienced agents. The innovative technology and comprehensive support further enhance Keller Williams’ appeal. Compass, while also offering advanced technology and structured training through Compass Academy, has higher fees and fewer income paths, which may limit its appeal to agents seeking comprehensive support and modern business solutions.

For a more detailed comparison and to find the best brokerage for your needs, check out our brokerage comparison tool.

When making your decision, consider your specific needs and career objectives. Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages carefully to choose the brokerage that best fits your professional aspirations. Whether you prioritize comprehensive support and training or seek a brokerage with a more conventional setup, your decision should align with your long-term career goals and preferences.

Today, we’re putting two of the most innovative names in the real estate industry head-to-head—eXp Realty and Real Broker. Choosing the right brokerage sets the foundation for your career success.

Pick the right one, and you’re on a solid path to growth. Pick the wrong one, and your momentum could stall. So, let’s break down both brokerages to see which might be the better fit for your needs. Here’s your handy dandy index:

Why Your Brokerage Choice Matters

Frequently Asked Questions

Why Your Brokerage Choice Matters

Your brokerage choice is about more than just your commission split. Sure, the paycheck matters, but the resources, training, support, and the day-to-day experience you’ll have as an agent are equally crucial. Picking the right brokerage means finding one that aligns with your goals and gives you the tools to maximize your income and build a thriving career.

eXp Realty vs. Real Broker: Overview

Both Real Broker and eXp Realty operate as cloud-based brokerages without traditional brick-and-mortar office spaces, which makes them flexible and efficient options for agents.

However, if you prefer having a place to work outside your home or a professional setting to meet clients, eXp Realty offers FREE access to over 4,000 Regus office business lounges worldwide. This gives eXp agents an extra edge for client meetings and collaborations in a formal setting.

Both brokerages are structured to provide agents with better commission splits by avoiding franchise owners’ layers, which means more money in the agents’ pockets. To understand more about that, check out the eXp Explained video found here.

eXp Realty vs. Real Broker: Agent Satisfaction

When evaluating brokerages, agent satisfaction is one of the most important factors. On Glassdoor, eXp Realty holds a 4.6-star rating from over 3,500 reviews, while Real Broker has a strong 4.5-star rating from 109 reviews.

Notably, eXp Realty has consistently made it onto Glassdoor’s Top 100 Companies list every year from 2018 to 2024, which speaks to the consistent agent satisfaction and company culture at eXp Realty. Real Broker has not yet made it onto this prestigious list.

If you’re curious about how the top real estate firms stack up, check out our blog “12 Insider Picks for the Best Real Estate Brokerage in 2024!” Spoiler alert: eXp Realty ranks #1 on Glassdoor.

eXp Realty vs. Real Broker: Brokerage Availability

Another key factor when selecting a brokerage is where they operate. eXp Realty is active in 50 states and 24 countries, with a powerful agent network of over 80,000 agents. This international presence offers unmatched opportunities for agents to collaborate globally, expand their client base, and build referral relationships across the world.

In comparison, Real Broker operates in 50 states and 2 countries, with around 20,000 agents. While Real Broker is growing, it doesn’t yet match the global reach and network size of eXp Realty. For agents seeking wider opportunities and broader resources, eXp Realty’s expansive network is a huge advantage.

eXp Realty vs. Real Broker: Brokerage Profitability

Why does profitability matter to you as an agent? A financially stable brokerage can continue to invest in tools, training, and support for its agents. When brokerages struggle financially, they often start cutting back on resources or adding fees that affect your bottom line.

Real Broker has posted 19 quarters of earnings but with only 1 profitable quarter, which raises questions about its long-term financial stability especially given the new NAR rules.

In contrast, eXp Realty has posted 20 quarters of earnings, with 15 profitable quarters—a profitability rate of 75%. Additionally, eXp Realty is the only publicly traded brokerage that’s been profitable for the past five years, signaling continued stability and growth.

If you want the full scoop on brokerage profitability, check out our blog “Top Real Estate Companies That Might Go Under!”

eXp Realty vs. Real Broker: Commission Splits

When it comes to commission splits, this is what agents often focus on most—it determines how much of your hard-earned commission stays with you.

Real Broker offers agents an 85/15 split until they hit their $12,000 cap, after which they keep 100% of their commission. Agents at Real can also earn up to $24,000 in company stock by meeting certain production milestones.

At eXp Realty, agents start with an 80/20 split, and once they’ve paid $16,000 to the brokerage for the year, they move to 100% commission. Agents at eXp Realty also earn stock for reaching specific production goals, and agents can earn their $16,000 cap back in company stock.

eXp Realty vs. Real Broker: Fees

Fees are another important consideration when choosing a brokerage. At Real Broker, agents pay a $249 joining fee, along with a $750 annual fee that’s collected over the first three sales each year.

There are no transaction fees until agents cap. eXp Realty keeps things straightforward, charging agents an $85 monthly fee and a $25 transaction fee per deal until they cap.

At Real Broker, agents pay $30 per sale for E&O insurance, which adds up over time but is manageable. At eXp Realty, agents pay $60 per transaction, and once you’ve paid $750 for the year, you’re capped and don’t have to pay any more E&O fees for the rest of the year.

eXp Realty vs. Real Broker: Training and Support

The right training and support can make all the difference, no matter where you are in your real estate career.

eXp Realty offers agents access to 50+ live training sessions each week, in addition to a massive on-demand library packed with resources for both new and experienced agents. New agents can get up to speed with the Fast Start program, while more experienced agents can take advantage of the Kick Start program to refine their skills and grow their business.

On top of all that, eXp Realty offers 24/7 support from over 2,000 full-time staff members, so you’ll never be left without help.

Real Broker offers around 30+ live hours of training each week, but beyond that, information about support is unclear. If you’re looking for comprehensive, around-the-clock support, eXp Realty seems to have the edge.

eXp Realty vs. Real Broker: Technology and Resources

Staying competitive in the real estate market means having the best tech at your fingertips, and eXp Realty excels in this area with its fully virtual setup.

Agents can do everything online, from attending training sessions to meeting with their broker, through the eXp World platform—a metaverse-style environment that allows real-time collaboration and interaction. Want more details? Check out our blog on eXp World here.

Additionally, eXp Realty provides agents with their own IDX website, a powerful kvCORE CRM, and a marketing center loaded with customizable templates for social media, flyers, and more.

Real Broker’s technology resources are less clear, and they don’t offer a metaverse-style environment like eXp World. Without detailed information on the tech available, it’s hard to draw a comparison, but eXp Realty’s extensive suite of tools is difficult to beat.

eXp Realty vs. Real Broker: Income Opportunities

When it comes to income opportunities, eXp Realty really shines, offering agents multiple ways to build long-term wealth. Beyond commission, agents can earn revenue share, receive stock production awards, and even purchase discounted stock—all designed to help agents grow their income and financial security.

While Real Broker also offers stock awards and the ability to purchase discounted stock, the revenue share pool is much smaller, at approximately $43 million, compared to eXp’s larger pool of $204 million. Additionally, Real Broker charges a $175 annual fee plus a 1.2% admin fee to participate in the revenue share program.

Another notable difference is that eXp Realty agents can offer unique value to attract agents to their sponsor line, giving them the opportunity to differentiate themselves from other sponsors. Real Broker agents, on the other hand, don’t have the ability to offer exclusive value, as all sponsors provide the same resources.

This entrepreneurial flexibility at eXp Realty gives agents an extra edge when it comes to building their revenue share. Learn more about eXp Realty’s amazing opportunity for revenue share income from our blog here.

eXp’s Exclusive Resources

Beyond the usual offerings, eXp Realty has a few game-changing features that other brokerages simply don’t provide. eXp Realty has a luxury division with global advertising around the world. eXp Realty has a dedicated team, Revenos, whose entire mission is to find and deliver top-quality leads directly to eXp agents—how great is that?

Then there’s eXp’s Referral tool that makes sending referrals to other agents effortless, and for those wanting to focus purely on referrals, eXp’s Referral Division slashes costs while keeping you active in the industry.

The bottom line is that because eXp Realty is uniquely profitable, eXp continues to innovate and provide more exclusive resources helping agents and their clients. eXp Realty works hard to maintain its tag line as the most agent-centric brokerage on the planet.

That’s a Wrap

When comparing eXp Realty to Real Broker, it’s clear that eXp Realty stands out with its larger global reach, transparent commission splits, and lower fees, along with its unparalleled training, support, and technology.

Real Broker is a solid option for agents seeking a competitive commission split and stock opportunities, but when it comes to overall value and income potential, eXp Realty holds the advantage.

This article will provide a comprehensive comparison between Century 21 vs Keller Williams to help you determine which brokerage better aligns with your professional goals. Choosing the right brokerage is a critical decision for any real estate agent, as it significantly impacts their career trajectory and financial success.

Commission Splits and Fees
Income Opportunities
Training and Support
Technology and Resources
Agent Satisfaction
Final Thoughts on Century 21 vs Keller Williams
Join our FREE Team at eXp Realty

Commission Splits and Fees

The commission splits and associated fees are crucial factors to consider when selecting a brokerage. Keller Williams offers flexible splits ranging from 70/30 to 100/0, with a 6% franchise/royalty fee until the cap is reached. Century 21 provides splits starting at 70/30 and going up to 92/8, with an 8% franchise/royalty fee that continues even after the cap is reached.

Monthly fees for Keller Williams vary by office, whereas Century 21’s fees range from $0 to $350 per month. Additionally, Keller Williams does not charge transaction fees, while Century 21 includes transaction fees within their royalty fees. These differences can impact an agent’s net income and financial planning, making it important to consider each brokerage’s fee structure.

Income Opportunities

The potential for additional income streams can significantly enhance an agent’s financial stability and growth. Keller Williams stands out by offering revenue share programs that provide a retirement and willable income path. These additional income streams can offer substantial long-term financial benefits and security. Conversely, Century 21 does not offer such supplementary income opportunities, limiting agents primarily to their commission-based earnings.

Training and Support

Effective training and support are vital for both new and experienced agents. Keller Williams excels in this area, providing extensive training opportunities, though specific details on the extent of their offerings are not standardized across all offices. Agents at Keller Williams also benefit from various support structures, although 24/7 support is not available. In contrast, Century 21 provides training that varies by office and lacks the extensive and consistent support system available at Keller Williams. This difference can be crucial for agents who require ongoing assistance and professional development.

Technology and Resources

In the modern real estate landscape, leveraging technology effectively is essential. Keller Williams is known for its robust technology platforms, offering tools that enhance productivity and client engagement. On the other hand, Century 21 only incorporates some technological tools. Both brokerages focus heavily on traditional, physical office spaces. Both might appeal to agents who prefer a more conventional working environment.

Agent Satisfaction

Agent satisfaction is a key indicator of a brokerage’s effectiveness and overall agent happiness. Keller Williams boasts a high Glassdoor rating of 4.3 stars based on 7.9K reviews, indicating strong agent approval and satisfaction. Century 21 holds a respectable 4.2-star rating from 1.5K reviews, though this suggests there are areas needing improvement. The differences in agent satisfaction can often be attributed to the varying levels of support, training, and income opportunities provided by each brokerage.

Final Thoughts on Century 21 vs Keller Williams

In comparing Century 21 and Keller Williams, it’s evident that Keller Williams offers more favorable commission splits, extensive training, and additional income opportunities, making it a compelling choice for both new and experienced agents. The innovative technology and comprehensive support further enhance Keller Williams’ appeal. Century 21, while offering a traditional structure with some technological integration, has higher fees and fewer income paths, which may limit its appeal to agents seeking comprehensive support and modern business solutions.

For a more detailed comparison and to find the best brokerage for your needs, check out our brokerage comparison tool.

When making your decision, consider your specific needs and career objectives. Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages carefully to choose the brokerage that best fits your professional aspirations. Whether you prioritize comprehensive support and training or seek a brokerage with a more conventional setup, your decision should align with your long-term career goals and preferences.

title: Top 17 Brokerage Interview Questions to Ask Before Choosing
excerpt: Need to choose a brokerage to hang your real estate license? It’s a critical choice that can easily shape your entire career. Pick the wrong…
content:
Need to choose a brokerage to hang your real estate license? It’s a critical choice that can easily shape your entire career. Pick the wrong brokerage and you could be among the 87% of new agents who give up their real estate dreams within five years.

So, how do you dodge that failure rate? You’ll need to ask the right questions when you interview with local real estate offices or conduct online research regarding cloud-based models. But what are the right questions? It’s not easy to know, especially is you’re a new agent.

But don’t sweat it! This article lays out exactly which brokerage interview questions you need to get answered. Stick with us to make your brokerage choice a stepping stone to success, not just another fail statistic. Here’s your handy dandy index:

Table of Contents

Starting Your Brokerage Search
Your Career Advantage
Evaluating Responses
Choosing the Right Brokerage Checklist
Making Your Choice
Next Steps
It’s a Wrap
Join our FREE Team at eXp Realty
Frequently Asked Questions

Starting Your Brokerage Search

Alright, you’ve snagged your real estate license. What’s the next move? Choosing the right brokerage can be a game-changer. Plus, it’s a decision that’s more complex than ever due to all the real estate industry disrupters.

There’s a lot to unpack here. Let’s kick things off by understanding the different brokerage models currently making waves.

Traditional brokerage models

Think classic franchise setup with brick-and-mortar offices where broker-owners manage recruitment. It’s the old-school way that is currently still very much in play.

Discount traditional brokerage models

Similar in vibe to traditional, but with a twist. That twist? Lower costs for clients and, yep, lower earnings for agents.

Hybrid brokerage models

These guys mix it up with physical offices and tech boosts. This model aims to lower costs through tech without ditching the office vibe completely.

Cloud-based brokerage models

The new kids on the block! These models ditch physical offices completely, cutting down middlemen and overhead. They’re all about using tech to streamline operations and empower agents like you to lead the way in recruitment.

Each model has its perks, depending on what you’re looking for. The brokerage model you choose will shape your career path. Let’s make sure it’s a shape you like!

Your Career Advantage

Before we get into the brokerage interview questions, there’s something else you should know. That is, interviewing for a real estate agent position is not like interviewing for most other jobs.

Why? Because you’re a revenue generator for any brokerage through your hard-earned commissions and the fees you pay to your brokerage. Additionally, most of your business expenses come out of your pocket, not your brokerages. So, unlike other jobs, real estate brokerages incur minimal costs when they bring you on board.

But here’s the twist: if you’re a new agent, the time invested in training you and meeting your day-to-day questions is huge. If a brokerage isn’t hiring, or if they pass on offering you a position, it’s likely due to a lack of structured training or adequate staff to support your growth.

This happens more commonly in franchise brokerages or smaller outfits. That’s because even if t the responsibility for answering your day-to-day questions often falls on just one person – the broker-owner of the franchise office. Hiring you depends on that broker’s time availability.

On the flip side, this time for new agents problem is better with some cloud-based brokerages. These modern setups often have dedicated staff ready to support new agents.

Additionally, at a cloud-based brokerage, the hiring process can be remarkably streamlined. Sometimes you can join the brokerage through just a simple online application, bypassing traditional interviews altogether.

This makes it easier and faster to kickstart your real estate career. But, before you hit the join button, be sure to get the brokerage interview questions answered.

Evaluating Responses

Last, before we get to the brokerage interview questions, let’s talk about how to really listen to the answers you’ll get. It’s not just the content of the answers that matters, but also how they’re delivered.

Genuine enthusiasm and openness in their responses can reveal a lot about the brokerage’s stability and their commitment to supporting your career. On the other hand, evasiveness or lack of detail can be significant red flags, signaling that the brokerage might not be the best fit for your ambitions.

So listen carefully – it’s about finding a supportive environment where you can thrive, not just a place to work.

Choosing the Right Brokerage Checklist

Alright, let’s get to those brokerage interview questions. Whether you’re sitting down face-to-face in a traditional brokerage office or filling out forms online for a cloud-based firm, you’ll want these answers.

Commission Splits

Commission splits vary widely across brokerages and they are likely to be the number one anchor to your earnings happiness. If you don’t understand all the ins and outs of commissions, check out our blog article “Best Real Estate Companies to Work For – By Commission Splits” on SmartAgentAlliance.com.

Key Questions to Ask:

  1. What commission split is offered by the brokerage?
  2. Does the commission split improve after reaching certain milestones?
  3. What specific sales targets or other requirements must I meet to qualify for a better split?

Fees

Time for the nitty-gritty of brokerage fees, which can significantly impact your take-home pay.

Key Questions to Ask:

  1. What are all the fees I’ll need to pay? Find out every fee you’ll encounter, including royalty fees, transaction fees, desk fees, and Errors & Omissions Insurance and more.
  2. When are these fees due? Are they payable upfront or are they deducted as you close each deal? Are the fees due monthly or annually?
  3. Are there any fee caps? For example, there might be a per-deal fee that ceases (“caps”) once you’ve done a certain number of deals.

Training Programs

The best brokerages provide robust new agent training and ongoing training for seasoned agents too.

Key Questions to Ask:

  1. What types of training are available, and who conducts it? You want these to be led by actively producing successful agents.
  2. Is the training live, on-demand, or both? You need to know how flexible the training options are to suit your changing needs.
  3. What specific areas do your training programs cover? You’re looking for a variety of training from mindset and task management to modern lead generation (like social media training) and contract handling.
  4. Are there any fees associated with training? Some brokerage talk about their training, but then you find out it’s done by a third party that charges thousands of dollars.

Technology

Technology in real estate is a necessity.

Key Questions to Ask:

  1. What specific technology tools does the brokerage offer? Do they provide a customer relationship management (CRM) tool, individual IDX websites, tools for managing deal documents or promoting listings?
  2. Are these tools included in my brokerage fees, or are there additional costs?
  3. Can I access a demonstration of these technology tools before deciding?
  4. How often does the brokerage unleash new technology or update it? If it’s not at least annually, their tech may already be outdated.

Day-to-Day Support

Quality support ensures you’re never alone when challenges arise, whether it’s handling transaction details, navigating client negotiations, or managing paperwork.

Key Questions to Ask:

  1. What type of support is available to agents and how do I access it? Determine if support is available by phone, chat, email or just FAQs online.
  2. Is support available 24/7 and who provides it? You’ll want to gauge whether support is quality, like a broker, or just random staff. And, you’ll want to know if they are available for urgent situations.
  3. How many staff members are dedicated to agent support, and what is their response time? Get an idea now if you’ll have to wait long for answers.
  4. Is there a dedicated mentor or point of contact for new agents? If you’re a new agent, you’ll want this, big time!

Lead Generation

Lead generation is how you fill your pipeline of potential clients. It’s the heart of your success.

and potential sales opportunities. A supportive brokerage can significantly enhance your ability to generate leads by providing both resources for independent lead generation and direct referrals. Understanding the types of lead generation support offered by a brokerage can help you choose a firm that aligns with your business style and goals.

Key Questions to Ask:

  1. Does the brokerage provide leads or referrals? If so, how many can I expect over what period? Are the leads fresh and qualified? Caution…agents often complain they were told they’d get leads but the reality is that the leads ended up being nonexistent, super rare, or of very low quality.
  2. What tools and resources does the brokerage offer for generating my own leads? We aren’t talking about training here. You want to know if they provide lead generation tools like the ability to quickly and inexpensively start an ad campaign or farm a neighborhood.
  3. Are there any fees associated with lead generation services? For example, sometimes agents give up a good chunk of their earned commission in exchange for the lead.

Marketing Support

Effective marketing is essential for real estate success.

Key Questions to Ask:

  1. What type of marketing support does the brokerage provide? Look for support that covers a broad range of marketing strategies, including digital marketing, direct mail, and professional listing presentations.
  2. Does the brokerage offer easily customizable flyers, letterhead, social media posts, listing packages, farming packages, etc.? High-quality visuals are necessary. You need to know how difficult and costly it will be for you to create them.
  3. How does the brokerage support newer or less traditional marketing efforts like email campaigns and social media marketing? Determine if they offer any innovative marketing methods that are quick, easy, and inexpensive to give you a competitive edge.

Stock Rewards

Stock rewards can be a significant incentive when choosing a brokerage with listed stock.

Key Questions to Ask:

  1. Does the brokerage offer stock rewards or can agents buy stock at a discount?
  2. How do I earn stock awards and when do those shares vest? You’ll want to know how much extra income you can expect and when that income becomes all yours.

Agent Perks

Agent perks can significantly enhance job satisfaction and financial well-being.

Key Questions to Ask:

  1. What kind of agent perks does the brokerage offer? Identify perks such as healthcare benefits, retirement plans, or passive income opportunities.
  2. Can I earn recruiting income and is it willable or available after retirement? If yes, inquire about how it’s earned and how much you can earn.

Office Space

Because most real estate client business happens in homes, the necessity of office space depends greatly on how you prefer to work.

Key Questions to Ask:

  1. What types of office spaces are available? For traditional brokerages, determine if you get a private office or cubicle. For cloud-based brokerages, find out if they offer office arrangements like Regus.
  2. Are there additional fees for different types of office spaces? Yep, sometimes there are additional charges.

Innovation

Because the real estate industry is quickly evolving and because there’s more brokerage competition than ever before, you need a brokerage that constantly innovates to meet that challenge.

Key Questions to Ask:

  1. How often does the brokerage add something innovative for agents or their clients? This needs to be several times a year!
  2. What new tools and resources were introduced in the last year? Here’s how you evaluate the quality of the tools and resources.

New Agent Mentorship

Mentorship is a game-changer for new real estate agents, accelerating their path to successful deal closures.

Key Questions to Ask:

  1. Does the brokerage offer structured mentorship programs for new agents? This will indicate if their mentorship program is well planned out.
  2. Who are the mentors and what are their credentials? This will give you an idea of the mentorship quality.
  3. How much does mentorship cost? There may be a fee or an extra deal split for the help.

Networking Opportunities

Networking with other agents opens up potential for referrals and business partnerships.

Key Questions to Ask:

  1. What types of networking opportunities does the brokerage provide? Note if they are local, national, or global opportunities.
  2. Are there local meetups, regional events, and/or national conferences? The more the better for you!
  3. Do the networking opportunities offer new skills training or meet influential industry professionals? This will tell you the baseline advantage of attending any events.

Culture and Values

A brokerage’s culture will define your work environment and job satisfaction.

Key Questions to Ask:

  1. How would you describe the brokerage’s culture? Try to determine if the environment is collaborative, competitive, or somewhere in between.
  2. Can I speak with some current agents about their experiences here? Talking to current agents gives you a real-world perspective on the day-to-day culture and how the brokerage supports its team.
  3. For cloud-based brokerages, what platforms are in place for agent interaction and community building? Knowing how you’ll communicate and collaborate with peers in a virtual environment is essential for cloud-based setups.

Brokerage Branding

Recognizable brokerage awards or a strong market presence can enhance your agent credibility making it easier to get clients. However, keep in mind that in real estate, you are really the brand.  Still, brokerage branding can help.

Key Questions to Ask:

  1. What distinguishes this brokerage from others?
  2. Has the brokerage received any notable awards or recognitions?

Client Perks

Offering unique client perks can set a brokerage apart and provide significant value to the clients you’ll serve. These perks can be the deciding factor for clients choosing to work with you.

Key Questions to Ask:

  1. Are renovation, cleaning, or staging services offered where payment is deferred until closing?
  2. Does the brokerage provide cash offers for clients not wanting to list?
  3. Does the brokerage have exclusive organized off-market property listings?
  4. Is there global marketing for high-end properties? Find out if those have an additional fee for you to provide.
  5. Are there any other client perks? Cover all bases with that final question.

Brokerage Model Sustainability

The real estate industry is going through significant growing pains. With the rise of efficient cloud-based models and new NAR rules potentially impacting commission rates, traditional brokerages are facing heavy challenges.

However, some cloud-based models are also struggling. That’s because some of these new kids on the block haven’t yet configured agent commissions, fees, and support that will make them profitable and sustainable.

You’ll want to ensure that the brokerage you choose is not only surviving but thriving. If your brokerage is not thriving, you’re likely to see agent commissions, fees, and support worsen. Plus, innovation will not keep pace with successful brokerages.

Key Questions to Ask:

  1. Was your brokerage profitable after all expenses last year? How about the year before that?
  2. If not, what strategies are in place to achieve future profitability?
  3. Has your brokerage raised fees or lowered agent commission in the last 5 years?
  4. If so, what were those changes?

Understanding a brokerage’s financial health will give you insight into whether the brokerage will stand the test of time.

Making Your Choice

Now, the tough part—making the decision. Don’t rush it. Reflect on how each brokerage’s offerings align with what matters most to you personally and professionally.

Is it the training, the support, the technology, the commission structure, the likely sustainability of the model, or a combination of things? Prioritizing these factors will help you make an informed choice that best supports your career goals in real estate.

Next Steps

Once you’ve made your choice, communicate it with clarity and confidence. If you’re on board, show your eagerness to start. If not, decline politely—thank them for the opportunity.

Remember, real estate is a tightly knit industry, and maintaining positive relationships is crucial, regardless of your decision. Keep those bridges intact for future opportunities.

It’s a Wrap

Picking the right brokerage is a big move. Think of it as finding a new home for your career. You want it to fit just right. You’ve got the tools and know-how to make a smart choice. Trust yourself.

Ready to get to it? Go nail that interview. Ask the tough questions because now you know what matters. Remember, it’s about finding a place where you can grow, learn, and thrive. Your future’s bright. Make this count. And hey, we’re here cheering you on every step of the way.

Join our FREE Team at eXp Realty

Not only will you be joining the ONLY profitable public brokerage in the past 5 years that agents rank as the best brokerage to work for, but you’ll also benefit from double the free resources (two teams in your upline) designed to help you succeed quickly and efficiently at eXp.

With the Wolf Pack, you’ll enjoy exclusive access to the Wolf Pack weekly webinars, the Social Agent Academy for social media training, the Wolf Pack Hub for easy onboarding, Investor Army for investing and flipping houses training.

With Smart Agent Alliance you’ll enjoy personalized day-to-day concierge care plus assets like customizable agent presentations, business automation, production checklists, customizable social media posts, and so much more.

Don’t miss out on this amazing opportunity to maximize your earnings and build a thriving real estate business. Join eXp Realty today and experience unparalleled support from both the Wolf Pack and Smart Agent Alliance.

Not quite convinced? No problem! Contact us to set up a meeting, request a personal link to a live webinar, and/or get all your questions answered via email, phone call, or video call. We’re here to help you succeed!

For more information, check out our eXp Realty overview, learn about our team benefits, and visit our Join Smart Agent Alliance page. Partner with us today and take your real estate career to the next level!

Frequently Asked Questions

What are the different real estate brokerage models?

Traditional brokerage models are the classic franchise setup with brick-and-mortar offices where broker-owners manage recruitment. Discount traditional brokerage models are those that discount their services and what agents earn. Hybrid brokerage models mix it up with physical offices and tech boosts to lower costs. Cloud-based brokerage models ditch physical offices completely, cutting down middlemen and overhead. They’re all about using tech to streamline operations.

How is interviewing as a real estate agent different than other professions?

It’s different because agents generate revenue for the brokerage through commissions while paying fees and most business expenses themselves, minimizing costs for the brokerage. However, the time investment in training new agents and addressing daily inquiries is substantial. Cloud-based brokerages better accommodate new agents with dedicated support staff and streamlined hiring processes, sometimes allowing agents to join through a simple online application, eliminating traditional interviews.

What real estate brokerage interview questions should I ask?

Ask about commission splits, fees, training, technology, lead generation, marketing support, stock rewards, mentorship, networking opportunities, company culture, and agent perks like: healthcare, retirement plans, and recruiting bonuses. Also ask how much the company innovates, how profitable is the company after expenses, and are their client perks like global advertising or renovations where the associated costs are zero until closing.

Why We Chose It:

AceableAgent has quickly become a favorite among students due to its modern approach and flexibility. It is exclusively focused on real estate education, offering courses for every step of a real estate career, from pre-licensing to continuing education and career advancement. The courses are state-approved and designed to be accessible from any device, providing students with the flexibility to study anywhere.

Overview:

AceableAgent offers three pre-licensing packages, all of which include the required coursework. The courses are fully online and accessible via desktop, laptop, tablet, or smartphone. This accessibility is one of AceableAgent’s standout features, allowing students to study on the go. Courses are developed by experienced professionals and are accredited by ARELLO. Additionally, AceableAgent is known for its interactive coursework, which helps students grasp and retain information effectively.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_video src=”https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sPEVlc9Zp_M” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”600px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”40px||40px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_video][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”16px” header_3_font_size=”20px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Why AceableAgent is Great for Pre-Licensing:

AceableAgent’s pre-licensing courses are available in multiple states, ensuring they meet state-specific requirements. The courses include engaging video lectures, interactive content, and practice exams to help students prepare effectively for their licensing exams. AceableAgent offers a satisfaction guarantee and provides career resources to help new agents start their careers successfully.

User Experiences and Feedback:

Students have reported that AceableAgent’s courses are particularly user-friendly, with a modern interface that makes navigation easy. The mobile app is highly rated for its convenience, allowing users to study during commutes or breaks. The interactive content, including quizzes and video explanations, has been praised for making complex topics easier to understand. Additionally, AceableAgent’s customer service, though sometimes slow, is generally helpful and responsive to student needs.

Extended Course Access: Access course materials for up to six months from your enrollment date.

Comprehensive Exam Preparation: Gain access to a variety of study tools including prep videos, 75 audio lessons, digital flashcards, over 1600 practice questions, a 100-page exam prep ebook, weekly live webinars, live Q&A sessions with instructors, and the option for personalized 1-on-1 tutoring.

Dedicated Support: Instructor assistance is available seven days a week via email, and customer service can be reached by email and phone from Monday to Friday.

Convenient Final Exams: Utilize online proctoring services for the final exam across the nation, although California students do not need a proctor for their pre-licensing exam.

Mobile-Friendly Platform: Study anytime, anywhere with a course platform that is fully optimized for mobile devices.

Interactive Learning Tools: Engage with interactive content designed to enhance your learning experience and retention.

Career Resources: Access additional career support services to help you transition from student to professional agent successfully.

Their courses are accredited by ARELLO and have received numerous awards for their educational programs.

Overview: The CE Shop’s pre-licensing courses can be taken in 34 states, through four different course packages: Courses Only, Standard Package, Value Package, and Premium Package. Every package comes with business ebooks, career resources, downloadable resources, real estate glossary, digital flashcards, study schedules, and access to instructor-led webinars. Students have praised the course content for being easy to follow and highly informative, which has led to high pass rates.

Final Exam Process: Virtual proctoring available nationwide; in California, the DRE administers the exam at designated centers.

User Experiences and Feedback: 360 Training Real Estate School is noted for its budget-friendly pricing and straightforward course design. _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”left” title_font_size=”31px” custom_margin=”||12px|||” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text Our Review Process:

At SmartAgentAlliance, our goal is to provide accurate and helpful reviews of online real estate schools to assist prospective real estate agents in making informed decisions. Our review process involves several key steps:

Research and Data Collection:

We begin by gathering comprehensive information about each real estate school, including course offerings, pricing, accreditation, and user reviews. This involves visiting the schools’ websites, reading third-party reviews, and gathering feedback from current and former students.

Evaluation Criteria:

Our evaluation is based on several important criteria, including:

    • Course Quality:

      We assess the content and structure of the courses to ensure they cover all necessary topics comprehensively and are easy to follow.

    • Accessibility:

      We evaluate the flexibility and accessibility of the courses, including the availability of mobile apps and study materials.

    • Pass Rates:

      We consider the pass rates of students who have completed the courses and taken the licensing exam.

    • Student Support:

      We look at the level of support provided to students, including access to instructors, customer service, and additional resources like study guides and practice exams.

    • Pricing:

      We compare the cost of the courses relative to the value they offer, including any discounts or payment plans available.

    • User Feedback:

      We gather and analyze feedback from students who have taken the courses to get an understanding of their experiences and satisfaction levels.

Scoring and Ranking:

Each school is scored based on the evaluation criteria, and an overall score is calculated. The scores are then used to rank the schools, with additional considerations given to standout features that may set a school apart from the rest.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title=”Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”left” title_font_size=”31px” custom_margin=”||11px|||” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_accordion open_toggle_text_color=”#000000″ toggle_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”#383838″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” toggle_text_color=”#000000″ toggle_level=”h3″ toggle_font=”|600|||||||” toggle_font_size=”23px” custom_margin=”16px||0px|||” rank_math_faq_schema=”on” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}” box_shadow_color__hover=”rgba(12,113,195,0.41)” box_shadow_color__hover_enabled=”on|hover”][et_pb_accordion_item title=”What are the top online real estate schools in California?” open=”on” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

AceableAgent, The CE Shop, Allied Real Estate Schools by Colibri, RealEstateU, and 360 Training.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”What is included in the pre-license courses for California?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

The pre-license courses for California real estate agents consist of 135 hours of approved education. This includes three 45-hour modules covering Real Estate Principles, Real Estate Practice, and a third elective course such as Real Estate Finance. These courses provide the necessary knowledge to prepare for the California salesperson licensing exam.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”How do I choose the best online real estate school in California?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

Consider factors such as course content, flexibility, cost, support services, and student reviews. Ensure the school is approved by the California Department of Real Estate (DRE) and offers the required 135-hour pre-license courses.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”Are online real estate courses self-paced?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

Yes, most online real estate courses are self-paced, allowing you to study at your own convenience. This flexibility is ideal for students who need to balance their studies with work or other commitments.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”Do online real estate schools offer exam prep?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

Support varies by school but generally includes access to instructors via email or chat, customer service support, and sometimes live webinars or Q&A sessions.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”How much do online real estate courses cost?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

The cost of online real estate courses varies by school and package. Basic pre-license courses can start around $100, while comprehensive packages with additional features like exam prep and career support can cost several hundred dollars.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”Can I get a refund if I’m not satisfied with the course?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

Most online real estate schools offer a refund policy, typically within a certain period (e.g., 30 days) if you haven’t completed a significant portion of the course. Check the specific refund policy of the school you choose.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”Is there support available if I have questions during the course?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

Yes, reputable online real estate schools offer student support through various channels such as email, phone, and live chat. Some also provide instructor-led webinars and Q&A sessions.

Before diving into the specifics, it’s essential to understand the basic requirements for a California real estate license. These are the fundamental criteria you must meet:

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”1530px” custom_padding=”30px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Age Requirement” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

You must be at least 18 years old to apply for a real estate license in California. This age requirement ensures that applicants have reached a level of maturity and legal responsibility necessary for the profession.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Residency and Identification” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

While you don’t need to be a California resident to obtain a license, you must have a Social Security number or an Individual Taxpayer Identification Number (ITIN). This identification is crucial for background checks and to ensure compliance with state regulations. Out-of-state applicants for a California real estate license must meet the same criteria as California residents.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Honesty and Integrity” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

You must be honest and truthful in all your dealings. The California Department of Real Estate (DRE) will conduct a thorough background check, and any conviction of a crime may result in the denial of your license. Being upfront about any past legal issues and demonstrating rehabilitation can positively impact your application.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ module_id=”core-step1″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off” background_image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/1-1.webp” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_horizontal_offset=”2%” background_vertical_offset=”2%” background_enable_pattern_style=”on” background_pattern_style=”smiles” background_pattern_color=”rgba(12,113,195,0.05)” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin=”4px|auto||auto||” custom_padding=”8px||7px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Step 1: Take a Real Estate Pre-Licensing Course” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”center” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”700px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”-23px||40px||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]

In California, you need to complete 135 hours of real estate pre-licensing education. This course covers essential topics like real estate principles, practices, and legal aspects

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”1000px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”-23px||40px||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]

“Any real estate practice course submitted for purposes of qualifying to take a real estate license exam, must include components on implicit bias and fair housing. Additionally, the fair housing component must include an interactive participatory component where the applicant role plays as both the consumer and the real estate professional.” -DRE

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title=”Course Breakdown” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”center” custom_margin=”||-17px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”1530px” custom_padding=”30px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Real Estate Principles (45 hours):” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

This course covers the fundamentals of real estate, including property ownership, land use controls, and regulations. Understanding these principles is essential for anyone entering the real estate field.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Real Estate Practice (45 hours):” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Real Estate Practice focuses on the practical aspects of working as a real estate agent. Topics include listing agreements, sales processes, and client relationships. This course prepares you for the day-to-day activities you will encounter in your real estate career.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Elective Courses (45 hours):” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

The elective course allows you to specialize in an area of interest, such as Real Estate Finance, Real Estate Appraisal, or Property Management. Choosing an elective that aligns with your career goals can provide a competitive edge.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Choosing the Right Real Estate School” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”center” custom_margin=”||-17px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” max_width=”700px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”21px||-29px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Selecting the right California real estate school is crucial. Look for accredited schools that offer flexibility, especially if you have a busy schedule. Online real estate courses in California can provide the convenience of studying at your own pace.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”1530px” custom_padding=”30px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Research and Reviews:” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/1-2.webp” alt=”a magnifying glass and yellow stars, how to get a real estate license in california” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Start by researching various California real estate schools and reading reviews from past students. Look for schools with high pass rates for the real estate exam and positive feedback on their teaching methods.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Online vs. In-Person:” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/2-2.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Decide whether you prefer online or in-person real estate classes in California. Online courses offer flexibility and convenience, allowing you to study at your own pace. In-person classes provide direct interaction with instructors and peers, which can enhance your learning experience.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Course Materials and Support:” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/3-1.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Evaluate the course materials and support services provided by the school. High-quality textbooks, interactive lessons, and access to instructors for questions can significantly impact your success. Some schools also offer additional resources like exam prep courses and study groups.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”3px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Daily Study Schedule:” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||400″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Create a daily study schedule that covers all exam topics, ensuring regular review sessions. (Asana provides a great FREE task manager)

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Flashcards:” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||400″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Utilize flashcards for key terms and concepts to enhance memorization. (These Quizlet Flashcards may be helpful)

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Practice Tests:” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” image_icon_width=”60px” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Regularly take practice tests to gauge your understanding and get familiar with the exam format. (Free California Real Estate Practice Exam)

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ module_id=”core-step2″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off” background_image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/2-1.webp” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_horizontal_offset=”2%” background_vertical_offset=”2%” background_enable_pattern_style=”on” background_pattern_style=”cubes” background_pattern_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.05)” background_pattern_size=”cover” box_shadow_style=”preset6″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”8px||7px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Step 2: Submit Your California Real Estate License Application” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”center” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”700px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”-23px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]

After completing your coursework, submit your license application to the DRE

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Steps to Submit Your Application” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”left” custom_margin=”5px||14px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_tabs active_tab_background_color=”#383838″ active_tab_text_color=”#FFFFFF” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” tab_font=”–et_global_body_font|500|||||||” tab_font_size=”16px” background_color=”#FFFFFF” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22active_tab_background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_tab title=”Step 1″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Complete the Application Form: Fill out the RE 435 form available on the DRE website. (click here)

[/et_pb_tab][et_pb_tab title=”Step 2″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Gather Required Documents: Include proof of completed pre-licensing education and identification documents.

[/et_pb_tab][et_pb_tab title=”Step 3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Schedule Fingerprinting: Use the Live Scan service to complete your background check.

[/et_pb_tab][et_pb_tab title=”Step 4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Submit Your Application: Mail or submit your application online through the DRE’s eLicensing system.

[/et_pb_tab][/et_pb_tabs][et_pb_heading title=”Application Processing Time” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” custom_margin=”55px||1px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

The DRE will take several weeks to process your application. During this time, they will review your transcripts and verify that you meet all the requirements. Make sure to double-check your application for completeness to avoid any delays.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title=”Tracking Your Application” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” custom_margin=”55px||1px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

You can track the status of your application online through the DRE’s website. Regularly checking the status can help you stay informed about any issues or additional requirements. If there are delays, contacting the DRE directly can provide clarity and expedite the process.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ module_id=”core-step3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off” background_image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/3.webp” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_horizontal_offset=”2%” background_vertical_offset=”2%” background_enable_pattern_style=”on” background_pattern_style=”smiles” background_pattern_color=”rgba(12,113,195,0.05)” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”8px||7px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Step 3: Pass the California Real Estate Exam” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”center” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”700px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”-23px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]

The exam is a 3-hour test with 150 multiple-choice questions. You need to score at least 70% to pass. Each attempt requires a new application and a fee of $60.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”||6px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Salesperson Examination Content” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”center” custom_margin=”5px||-17px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_4,1_4,1_4,1_4″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”2″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”1530px” custom_padding=”30px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”PROPERTY OWNERSHIP AND LAND USE CONTROLS AND REGULATIONS (APPROXIMATELY 15% OF EXAM)” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Property-and-MArke-Training.webp” alt=”a house with a garage, Property and Market Training” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ header_font_size=”18px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

_module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”||6px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading
