global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_4,1_4,1_4,1_4″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”1530px” custom_padding=”30px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Review Course Materials: ” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Course-Material.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

Go over the textbooks and notes from your pre-license courses. Revisiting these materials can reinforce your understanding of key concepts. Focus on areas where you feel less confident to ensure a well-rounded preparation.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Practice Exams: ” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Practice-Exams.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

Take as many practice exams as possible. This helps you get familiar with the exam format and identify areas where you need more study. Practice exams can also help you manage your time effectively during the actual test. (Free California Real Estate Practice Exam)

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Study Groups: ” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Study-Group.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

Join or form study groups. Discussing topics with peers can enhance understanding and retention. Study groups provide a platform to share knowledge, ask questions, and support each other.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Exam Prep Courses:” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Exam-Prep-Course.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

Consider enrolling in an exam prep course for additional support and structured study. These courses often include practice exams, study guides, and expert instruction. Investing in a prep course can increase your chances of passing the exam on the first attempt.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”||3px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Exam Day Tips” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”center” custom_margin=”10px||-10px||false|false” custom_padding=”||0px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_4,1_4,1_4,1_4″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”1530px” custom_margin=”-11px|auto||auto||” custom_padding=”30px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Arrive Early: ” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Arrive-Early.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

Ensure you arrive at the exam center early to avoid any last-minute stress. Arriving early gives you time to settle in and focus before the exam begins. Check the location and travel time in advance to plan your journey.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Bring Required Identification:” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Bring-Required-Identification.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

You’ll need a valid photo ID to enter the exam. Make sure your ID is current and matches the name on your application. Having all necessary documents ready can prevent any issues at the exam center.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Stay Calm and Focused:” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Stay-Calm.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

Read each question carefully and manage your time wisely. Staying calm and composed can help you think clearly and avoid mistakes. Take deep breaths and stay positive throughout the exam.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#fcfcfc” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Exam Room Etiquette:” image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Etiquette.webp” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

Follow all instructions given by the exam proctors. Adhering to the rules ensures a smooth and fair testing experience for everyone. If you have any questions or issues, ask the proctors for assistance.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ module_id=”core-step4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off” background_image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/4.webp” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_horizontal_offset=”2%” background_vertical_offset=”2%” background_enable_pattern_style=”on” background_pattern_style=”cubes” background_pattern_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.05)” background_pattern_size=”cover” box_shadow_style=”preset6″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”8px||7px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Step 4: Complete the Fingerprinting Requirement” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”center” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”700px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”-23px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]

After passing the exam, you must complete a fingerprinting requirement for a background check. This is a mandatory step to ensure you meet the honesty and integrity standards set by the DRE.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”How to Get Fingerprinted” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”left” custom_margin=”5px||14px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_tabs active_tab_background_color=”#383838″ active_tab_text_color=”#FFFFFF” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” tab_font=”–et_global_body_font|500|||||||” tab_font_size=”16px” background_color=”#FFFFFF” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22active_tab_background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_tab title=”Live Scan Service: ” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Use a Live Scan service provider approved by the California Department of Justice. Live Scan is an electronic fingerprinting process that is fast and secure. Locate a service provider near you and schedule an appointment. (You can get this done at UPS for $65)

[/et_pb_tab][et_pb_tab title=”Submit the Live Scan Form: ” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Fill out and submit the RE Form 237 (click here) along with the fingerprinting fee. The Live Scan service provider will electronically transmit your fingerprints to the Department of Justice. Keep a copy of the form and receipt for your records.

[/et_pb_tab][et_pb_tab title=”Fingerprinting Fees:” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Be prepared to pay the fingerprinting fee, which varies by provider. The fee typically includes the cost of the Live Scan service and the background check. Confirm the total cost when scheduling your appointment.

[/et_pb_tab][/et_pb_tabs][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

The DRE will conduct a background check using your fingerprints. This check ensures you meet the honesty and integrity standards required for a real estate license. Any issues identified during the background check may need to be addressed before your license is granted.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title=”Addressing Background Check Issues” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” custom_margin=”44px||1px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

If any issues arise during the background check, be prepared to provide additional documentation or explanations. Demonstrating honesty and taking responsibility for past actions can positively impact the DRE’s decision. Seek legal advice if necessary to navigate any complex issues.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ module_id=”core-step5″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off” background_image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/5.webp” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_horizontal_offset=”2%” background_vertical_offset=”2%” background_enable_pattern_style=”on” background_pattern_style=”smiles” background_pattern_color=”rgba(12,113,195,0.05)” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”8px||7px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Step 5: Submit the Salesperson License Application” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”center” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”700px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”-23px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]

The next step is to submit the Salesperson License Application. This application confirms that you have passed the exam and completed the fingerprinting requirement.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”||6px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Application Checklist” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”center” custom_margin=”5px||-17px|||” custom_padding=”||3px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_4,1_4,1_4,1_4″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”1530px” custom_padding=”30px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Complete the RE Form 435:” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||400″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Fill out the form available on the DRE website. Ensure all sections are completed accurately. You can access the form here.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Attach Exam Results:” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Include proof that you passed the exam. This documentation is crucial for the DRE to verify your eligibility. Keep a copy of your exam results for your records.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Include Fingerprinting Proof:” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

Attach your Live Scan Service form. This proof confirms that you have completed the fingerprinting requirement. Ensure all necessary signatures and details are included.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c” custom_padding=”15px|15px|15px|15px|true|true” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset2″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_blurb title=”Pay the License Fee:” use_icon=”on” font_icon=”||fa||900″ icon_color=”gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ header_text_color=”#FFFFFF” body_text_color=”#FFFFFF” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-8f9e88d2-40a2-47c8-bfca-a16036dfef5e%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93}”]

As of 2023, the fee is $245. This fee must be submitted along with your application. Keep a copy of your payment receipt for future reference.

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”700px” module_alignment=”center” global_colors_info=”{}”]

After submitting your application, you can track its status online through the DRE’s website. Regularly checking the status can help you stay informed about any updates or additional requirements. If there are delays, contacting the DRE directly can provide clarity and expedite the process.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ module_id=”core-step6″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off” background_image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/6.webp” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_horizontal_offset=”2%” background_vertical_offset=”2%” background_enable_pattern_style=”on” background_pattern_style=”cubes” background_pattern_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.05)” background_pattern_size=”cover” box_shadow_style=”preset6″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”8px||7px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Step 6: Find a Real Estate Broker to Sponsor You” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”center” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”700px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”-23px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Once you pass the exam, you need to find a sponsoring broker to activate your license. Look for a brokerage that aligns with your goals and offers the support you need.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Considerations” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”left” custom_margin=”5px||14px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_tabs active_tab_background_color=”#383838″ active_tab_text_color=”#FFFFFF” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” tab_font=”–et_global_body_font|500|||||||” tab_font_size=”16px” background_color=”#FFFFFF” border_radii=”on|10px|10px|10px|10px” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22active_tab_background_color%22%93}”][et_pb_tab title=”Brokerage Culture:” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Find a supportive and collaborative environment. The right culture can significantly impact your job satisfaction and success.

[/et_pb_tab][et_pb_tab title=”Commission Splits: ” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Understand the financial arrangements. Different brokerages offer different commission splits, so choose one that suits your financial goals.

[/et_pb_tab][et_pb_tab title=”Training and Mentorship: ” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Choose a broker who provides ample training and mentorship opportunities. Early career support is crucial for your development and success.

[/et_pb_tab][/et_pb_tabs][et_pb_heading title=”Questions to Ask Potential Brokers” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” custom_margin=”44px||1px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

17 Brokerage Interview Questions

  • What training programs do you offer for new agents?
  • How does your commission split work, and are there any additional fees?
  • What kind of support and resources will I have access to?
  • Can you provide references from other agents in your brokerage?

Choosing the right broker is crucial as it impacts your early career significantly. Consider top-rated brokers like eXp Realty, Keller Williams, Coldwell Banker, and Compass.

global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.26.1″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Financial Planning” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h2″ title_text_align=”center” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”700px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”-23px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Starting a career in real estate involves some initial costs and financial planning. Understanding these costs and planning accordingly will help you manage your finances effectively.

All stated fees are subject to change.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”||0px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_heading title=”Starting Costs” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”left” custom_margin=”5px||14px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” custom_margin=”||0px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • Initial Expenses: These include licensing fees, marketing expenses, office supplies, and technology tools needed to start your career. For example, initial expenses may include:
    • Pre-Licensing Course: $99-$700
    • Exam Fee: $60 per attempt
    • Application Fee: $245
    • Fingerprinting Fee: Roughly $60
    • Marketing Materials: Business cards, signage, and online advertising costs

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” custom_margin=”||0px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • Once you join a brokerage, many will require you to join the National, State, and local Association of Realtors. There will also be MLS fees and Suprakey fees.
    • National Association of Realtors (NAR):
      • Membership Fees: The annual dues for NAR are $156 for 2024. There’s also a $45 special assessment fee for the Consumer Advertising Campaign, bringing the total to $201 per year.
    • California Association of Realtors (CAR):
      • Membership Fees: For 2024, the dues for the California Association of Realtors are $184 annually. This fee is separate from the NAR dues.
    • Local Association of Realtors:
      • Membership Fees: Local association fees in California vary depending on the specific association. For example:
        • Marin Association of Realtors: The annual dues are approximately $245.
        • Los Angeles Southwest Association of Realtors (LASAOR): The fees are around $200 to $300 per year.
    • Multiple Listing Service (MLS):
      • Fees: MLS fees can differ significantly based on the region. For instance, BAREIS MLS, serving the Marin County area, charges around $420 annually. Other MLS services in California might have similar or slightly different fee structures.
    • Supra Key Fees:
      • Fees: Supra Key services typically include an initial setup fee and a monthly or annual service fee. In California, the eKEY service costs about $20 to $25 per month. The setup fee is generally around $50.

These fees are approximate and can vary slightly depending on your exact location and the specific associations or MLS you join. It’s always a good idea to verify with the local associations or MLS for the most accurate and up-to-date information.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title=”Budgeting Tips” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” custom_margin=”40px||1px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • Create a Budget: Track your expenses and forecast your income. Plan for slower months to ensure financial stability.
  • Emergency Fund: Set aside an emergency fund to cover unexpected expenses or slow periods in the market

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title=”Income Management” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_font=”||||on||||” title_text_align=”left” custom_margin=”5px||14px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”15px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • Commission Structure: Real estate agents typically earn commissions from sales. Understand how your brokerage’s commission structure works and how to manage irregular income streams. Commission splits can vary widely, typically ranging from 50/50 to 70/30 or higher, depending on the brokerage.
  • Tax Planning: As an independent contractor, it’s important to plan for taxes. Keep track of deductible expenses, make estimated tax payments, and maintain good record-keeping practices. Consulting with a tax professional can help ensure compliance and optimize your tax strategy.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off” background_enable_image=”off” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-c5cf217d-3dcd-4d50-b4a1-19159ac8559c%22:%91%22icon_color%22%93,%22gcid-36fd78a7-34bc-404d-873c-dafa34efaae5%22:%91%22quote_icon_color%22,%22icon_color%22,%22open_toggle_text_color%22%93,%22gcid-f2943306-fa6c-45f0-b632-5fc00151366a%22:%91%22icon_color%22,%22open_toggle_text_color%22%93,%22gcid-3e0ae39b-d026-4173-b444-0c785917aeff%22:%91%22body_text_color%22%93,%22gcid-828accbb-1ed2-407d-95be-20ab4e191566%22:%91%22border_color_all%22%93}” box_shadow_color__hover=”rgba(12,113,195,0.41)” box_shadow_color__hover_enabled=”on|hover”][et_pb_accordion_item title=”What are the requirements to get a California real estate license?” open=”on” _builder_version=”4.21.0″ _module_preset=”550abe5c-b505-4d6b-adc7-570bd7cc1217″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

To qualify for a California real estate license, you must be at least 18 years old, a U.S. citizen or legal resident, and complete 135 hours of pre-licensing education.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”How much does it cost to get a real estate license in California?” _builder_version=”4.21.0″ _module_preset=”550abe5c-b505-4d6b-adc7-570bd7cc1217″ global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

The costs include a pre-licensing course ($99-$700), an exam fee ($60 per attempt), an application fee ($245), and a fingerprinting fee ($60). Additional costs may include test prep courses ($50-$200) and license renewal ($245 every four years).

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”How long does it take to get a real estate license in California?” _builder_version=”4.21.0″ _module_preset=”550abe5c-b505-4d6b-adc7-570bd7cc1217″ global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

The timeline varies but typically includes 135 hours of coursework, scheduling and passing the exam, and completing the fingerprinting and application processes. On average, it can take 4-6 months.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”What is the pass rate for the California real estate exam?” _builder_version=”4.21.0″ _module_preset=”550abe5c-b505-4d6b-adc7-570bd7cc1217″ global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

The pass rate for the California real estate exam is 70% or higher. Proper preparation, including practice exams and study groups, can significantly improve your chances of passing.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”What happens if I fail the California real estate exam?” _builder_version=”4.21.0″ _module_preset=”550abe5c-b505-4d6b-adc7-570bd7cc1217″ global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

If you fail the exam, you can retake it. Each attempt requires a $60 fee. It’s advisable to review your study materials and consider additional prep courses before retaking the exam.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”How do I renew my California real estate license?” _builder_version=”4.21.0″ _module_preset=”550abe5c-b505-4d6b-adc7-570bd7cc1217″ global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

To renew your license, you must complete 45 hours of continuing education and pay a renewal fee of $245 every four years. Staying current with your education ensures you remain knowledgeable and compliant with industry standards.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][/et_pb_accordion][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]

In most states, you need to complete pre-licensing education covering essential topics like real estate principles, practices, and legal aspects.

Choosing the Right Real Estate School

  • Research and Reviews: Look for schools with high pass rates and positive feedback.
  • Online vs. In-Person: Choose based on your schedule and learning preferences.
  • Course Materials and Support: Ensure the school provides high-quality resources and instructor access.

Study Tips

  • Daily Study Schedule: Create a schedule for regular review sessions. (Asana provides a great FREE task manager)
  • Flashcards: Use flashcards for key terms and concepts.
  • Practice Tests: Regularly take practice tests to familiarize yourself with the exam format.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_button button_url=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/real-estate-schools-online/” button_text=”Top Real Estate Schools” button_alignment=”left” button_alignment_tablet=”left” button_alignment_phone=”center” button_alignment_last_edited=”on|phone” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” button_text_size=”17px” button_text_color=”#000000″ button_bg_image=”https://wp.saabuildingblocks.com/staging/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Gold-Button-Image.webp” button_border_color=”RGBA(255,255,255,0)” button_border_radius=”10px” button_font=”|600||on|||||” custom_margin=”4px||1px||false|false” button_text_size_tablet=”17px” button_text_size_phone=”17px” button_text_size_last_edited=”on|tablet” box_shadow_color=”rgba(51,51,51,0.82)” locked=”off” global_colors_info=”{}” button_text_color__hover=”#fcfcfc” button_bg_use_color_gradient__hover=”on” button_icon_color__hover=”#000000″ button_icon_color__hover_enabled=”on|hover” button_bg_enable_image__hover=”off” button_bg_color_gradient_stops__hover=”#2b87da 0%|#29c4a9 100%” button_bg_enable_color__hover=”off”][/et_pb_button][et_pb_heading title=”Step 2: Submit Your Real Estate License Application” module_id=”core-step2″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_text_align=”left” custom_margin=”50px||-1px|||” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” min_height=”101px” custom_margin=”||2px||false|false” custom_padding=”||0px||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • Complete the Application Form: Fill out the required form on your state’s real estate regulatory website.
  • Application Processing Time: Processing can take several weeks. Ensure your application is complete to avoid delays.
  • Tracking Your Application: Track your application status online and contact the regulatory body if there are delays.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title=”Step 3: Pass the Real Estate Exam” module_id=”core-step3″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_text_align=”left” custom_margin=”20px||-3px|||” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin=”||1px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”]

The exam is typically a 3-hour test with multiple-choice questions. A minimum score of 70% is usually required to pass.

Preparation Tips

  • Review Course Materials: Revisit textbooks and notes from pre-license courses.
  • Practice Exams: Take practice exams to familiarize yourself with the format.
  • Study Groups: Join or form study groups for discussion and shared learning.
  • Exam Prep Courses: Enroll in prep courses for structured study and practice.

Exam Day Tips

  • Arrive Early: Avoid last-minute stress by arriving early.
  • Bring Required Identification: Ensure you have a valid photo ID.
  • Stay Calm and Focused: Manage your time wisely and stay composed.
  • Exam Room Etiquette: Follow all instructions and ask for help if needed.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title=”Step 4: Complete the Fingerprinting Requirement (most states)” module_id=”core-step4″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_text_align=”left” custom_margin=”23px||1px|||” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin=”||21px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”]

After passing the exam, complete fingerprinting for a background check to meet honesty and integrity standards.

Steps to Get Fingerprinted

  1. Live Scan Service: Use an approved provider and schedule an appointment.
  2. Submit the Form: Follow service instructions.
  3. Pay Fees: Typically $15 to $80, varying by state.

Addressing Issues

  • Provide additional documentation if needed. Demonstrate honesty and responsibility.

Note

Most states require fingerprinting, but some do not. Check your state’s specific requirements.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title=”Step 5: Submit the Salesperson License Application” module_id=”core-step5″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_text_align=”left” custom_margin=”40px||0px|||” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin=”||2px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Submit your application after passing the exam and completing fingerprinting, as required by your state.

Application Checklist

  1. Complete the Application Form: Fill out the necessary form from your state’s real estate regulatory website.
  2. Attach Exam Results: Include proof of passing the exam.
  3. Include Fingerprinting Proof: Submit your fingerprinting completion form, if required by your state.
  4. Pay the License Fee: Submit the required fee (amount varies by state).

After submission, track your application status online and address any additional requirements promptly.

Note

While the basic steps are similar, specific requirements and fees vary by state. Always refer to your state’s real estate regulatory body for precise instructions.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title=”Step 6: Find a Real Estate Broker to Sponsor You” module_id=”core-step6″ _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_text_align=”left” custom_margin=”40px||-2px|||” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin=”||-6px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Next, you need a sponsoring broker to activate your license. Look for a brokerage that aligns with your goals and offers the support you need.

Considerations

  1. Brokerage Culture: Find a supportive and collaborative environment.
  2. Commission Splits: Understand how commission splits work and any additional fees.
  3. Training and Mentorship: Ensure there are programs for new agents and ongoing support.

Questions to Ask Potential Brokers

Top 17 Brokerage Interview Questions

  • What training programs do you offer for new agents?
  • How does your commission split work, and are there any additional fees?
  • What kind of support and resources will I have access to?
  • Can you provide references from other agents in your brokerage?

Choosing the right broker is crucial for your early career success.

    [/et_pb_text][et_pb_heading title=”Financial Planning” module_id=”core-step6″ _builder_version=”4.27.2″ _module_preset=”default” title_level=”h3″ title_text_align=”left” custom_margin=”40px||-2px|||” title_text_shadow_style=”preset1″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_heading][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.27.2″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin=”||-6px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”]

    These are ballparked numbers for you to generalize how much everything may cost. Hint: it’s not cheap to start out in real estate.

    Starting a career in real estate across the U.S. involves several initial expenses and requires careful financial planning. Here’s a breakdown of typical costs and planning tips:

    Starting Costs

    1. Initial Expenses: Includes licensing fees, marketing expenses, office supplies, and technology tools. Typical costs might be:

      • Pre-Licensing Course: $99-$700
      • Exam Fee: $60 per attempt
      • Application Fee: $245
      • Fingerprinting Fee: Approximately $60
      • Marketing Materials: Costs for business cards, signage, and online advertising

    2. Professional Memberships:

      • National Association of Realtors (NAR): Annual dues approximately $156, plus a $45 special assessment for the Consumer Advertising Campaign, totaling around $201.
      • State and Local Associations: Membership fees can vary. Typically, local Realtor association fees range from $200 to $300 annually.Multiple Listing Service (MLS): Fees can vary significantly by region. Generally, expect to pay anywhere from $300 to $500 annually.Supra Key Fees: Include an initial setup fee and a monthly or annual service fee, generally around $50 for setup and $20 to $25 per month for service.

    Budgeting Tips

    • Create a Budget: Track expenses and forecast income, planning for slower months to maintain financial stability.
    • Emergency Fund: Set aside funds to cover unexpected costs or slow periods.

    Income Management

    • Commission Structure: Real estate agents earn through sales commissions. Commission splits vary widely, typically from 50/50 to 80/20 or higher, depending on the brokerage.
    • Tax Planning: As an independent contractor, keep track of deductible expenses, make estimated tax payments, and maintain good records. Consult a tax professional to ensure compliance and optimize tax strategy.

    These estimates are subject to change and can vary by location and specific circumstances. Always check local regulations and consult with local Realtor associations for the most accurate and up-to-date information.

box_shadow_color__hover_enabled=”on|hover”][et_pb_accordion_item title=”What are the basic requirements to obtain a real estate license?” open=”on” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

      Generally, all states require a high school diploma or equivalent, U.S. citizenship, proof of state residency, and completion of state-approved pre-licensing courses. Additionally, many states mandate a background check and may require proof of errors and omissions insurance.

      1. Age: Most states require applicants to be at least 18 years old. Some states, like New York, require applicants to be at least 20 years old to become a broker.
      2. Education: A high school diploma or equivalent is typically required. Additionally, applicants must complete state-approved pre-licensing courses, which cover real estate principles, laws, and practices. The number of required hours varies by state, ranging from 40 to 180 hours.
      3. Residency: Applicants must be permanent residents of the state in which they are applying for the license.
      4. Background Check: Most states require a criminal background check to ensure the applicant has no disqualifying criminal history.
      5. Pre-Licensing Education: Completion of pre-licensing education is mandatory. The specific number of hours and the content of these courses depend on state regulations. For example, New York requires 77 hours of coursework for agents and 152 hours for brokers.
      6. Examination: Applicants must pass a state licensing exam that tests their knowledge of real estate laws, practices, and principles. The exam typically includes both national and state-specific sections.
      7. Sponsorship: In some states, like New York, applicants must be sponsored by a licensed real estate broker to activate their license.

      Additional Considerations

      • License Reciprocity: Some states have reciprocity agreements with other states, which can simplify the licensing process for those already licensed elsewhere. This may allow applicants to skip certain pre-licensing requirements but still necessitates passing state-specific portions of the exam.
      • Continuing Education: After obtaining a license, most states require real estate professionals to complete continuing education courses to maintain their license and stay updated on industry changes.

        [/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”How long does it take to get a real estate license?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

        On average, it takes about 4-6 months to get a real estate license through traditional classroom courses. However, if you take online real estate pre-licensing courses, you can potentially complete the process more quickly:

        • Online courses can be completed in as little as 8 weeks, depending on how quickly you pace yourself.
        • In California specifically, the quickest you can get your real estate license is approximately 14.5 weeks (about 3.5 months).
        • Some online schools report that students can complete the process in 2-5 months on average.

        Key Factors Affecting the Timeline:

        1. State requirements for pre-licensing education hours: For example, California requires 135 hours.
        2. Whether you take online or classroom courses: Online is generally faster.
        3. How much time you can dedicate to studying: Self-paced online courses allow for flexibility.
        4. The exam application and scheduling process: This can take 6-8 weeks in some states.
        5. Time needed to study for and pass the licensing exam: Preparation time varies by individual.

        Fastest Possible Timeline Breakdown:

        • Pre-licensing education: 7.5 weeks minimum (for online courses in California).
        • Exam application processing: 6-8 weeks.
        • Exam scheduling and taking: 1-2 weeks.

        Keep in mind that while it’s possible to complete the process quickly, taking more time to thoroughly learn the material can be beneficial for passing the exam and starting your career.

        [/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”How hard is the real estate exam?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

        • The exam is considered challenging and requires thorough preparation. It tests knowledge of real estate principles, laws, and practices, and a significant portion of the exam focuses on vocabulary and key concepts.
        1. Pass rates vary by state, typically ranging from 50% to 70% for first-time test takers.
        2. The exam covers a wide range of topics, including property ownership, land use regulations, financing, and real estate calculations.
        3. Most states have a time limit of 2-4 hours for the exam, which can add pressure.
        4. The exam usually consists of 100-150 multiple-choice questions, testing both national and state-specific real estate knowledge.
        5. Many test-takers find the math questions and state-specific laws to be the most challenging aspects.
        6. Successful candidates typically dedicate 2-4 weeks of focused study time before the exam.

        While the exam is designed to be comprehensive and challenging, it’s important to remember that with thorough preparation and study, most candidates can pass successfully.

        [/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”What topics are covered on the real estate exam?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

        The real estate exam typically covers a variety of topics essential for understanding real estate practices and laws. Key areas of focus include:

        1. Real Estate Principles: Fundamental concepts and terminology related to real estate transactions, ownership, and property rights.
        2. Real Estate Practices: Practical applications of real estate principles, including the processes involved in buying, selling, and leasing properties.
        3. Property Ownership: Different types of property ownership, including freehold and leasehold estates, and the rights associated with each.
        4. Land Use Regulations: Understanding zoning laws, land use planning, and environmental regulations that affect property development and use.
        5. Financing: Knowledge of various financing options available for real estate transactions, including mortgages, loans, and the role of financial institutions.
        6. Real Estate Calculations: Mathematical concepts related to property valuation, commissions, and financing, which are often tested in the exam.
        7. State-Specific Laws: Each state has its own set of laws and regulations governing real estate transactions, which candidates must understand to pass the exam.
        8. Ethics and Professional Conduct: Understanding the ethical responsibilities of real estate professionals and the importance of maintaining integrity in transactions.

        Candidates are advised to review both national and state-specific materials to ensure comprehensive preparation for the exam.

        [/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”How long is the real estate exam?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

        The duration of the real estate exam varies by state, but generally falls within the following parameters:

        1. Most real estate licensing exams last between 1.5 to 3.5 hours.
        2. The exam is typically divided into two parts: a national portion and a state-specific portion.
        3. In California, for example, the salesperson exam consists of 150 multiple-choice questions with a time limit of 3 hours and 15 minutes.
        4. The broker exam in California is more extensive, with 200 questions and a time limit of 5 hours.
        5. Some states, like New York, allow up to 1.5 hours for the salesperson exam and 2.5 hours for the broker exam.
        6. The number of questions can range from 100 to 150 for most states, influencing the overall exam duration.

        It’s important to note that the exact length can vary, and candidates should check with their state’s real estate commission or licensing board for the most accurate and up-to-date information.

        [/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”How many questions can I miss and still pass the real estate exam?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

        The number of questions you can miss and still pass the real estate exam varies by state, but generally:

        1. Most states require a passing score of 70-75%, meaning you can miss 25-30% of the questions and still pass.
        2. In California, for example, the salesperson exam consists of 150 multiple-choice questions, and you need to answer at least 105 questions correctly (70%) to pass.
        3. For the California broker exam, which has 200 questions, you need to answer at least 150 correctly (75%) to pass.
        4. In New York, the passing score is 70% for both the salesperson and broker exams.
        5. Some states, like Florida, require a higher passing score of 75%, allowing fewer missed questions.
        6. The exact number of questions you can miss depends on the total number of questions on your state’s exam, which can range from 100 to 200.

        It’s important to note that while you can afford to miss some questions, aiming for a higher score is always beneficial. This ensures you have a buffer in case you encounter particularly challenging questions.

        [/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”What happens if I fail the real estate exam?” _builder_version=”4.27.0″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

        If you fail the real estate exam, the process for retaking it varies by state, but generally includes the following steps:

        1. Retake Eligibility: Most states allow candidates to retake the exam after failing. However, there may be a waiting period before you can attempt it again, typically ranging from a few days to a few weeks.
        2. Exam Fees: You will likely need to pay a retake fee each time you attempt the exam. This fee can vary depending on the state and the testing provider.
        3. Preparation: It is advisable to review your study materials and identify areas where you struggled before retaking the exam. Many candidates find it helpful to take additional practice exams or enroll in a prep course to improve their chances of passing on the next attempt.
        4. State-Specific Rules: Each state has its own rules regarding how many times you can retake the exam and any additional requirements that may apply. For example, some states may require you to complete additional coursework if you fail multiple times.
        5. Passing Score: Remember that the passing score typically ranges from 70% to 75%, so understanding the exam format and content is crucial for success.
        6. Time Limit: After passing the exam, you usually have a limited time frame (often six months) to apply for your real estate license. Failing to do so may require you to retake the exam again.

        Overall, while failing the exam can be discouraging, many candidates successfully pass on their subsequent attempts with proper preparation and study.
